Definition: How often player looks to finish possessions with a shot (usage tendency).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 emergency; 20 reluctant; 30 occasional; 40 rotation scorer; 50 featured; 60 primary; 70 heliocentric
Notes / locked rules: High Shot must be balanced with Touch + Play Discipline to avoid chucking.

Definition: How often offense flows through player (touches/initiations/handoffs/resets).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 ignored; 10 emergency; 20 low-touch; 30 connector; 40 rotation hub; 50 secondary hub; 60 primary hub; 65 cap
Notes / locked rules: Touch ? initiator skill; it’s involvement/priority.

Definition: Frequency of shots from ~3–10 feet (push shots, short hooks, short fades).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 emergency; 20 rare; 30 occasional; 40 normal; 50 featured; 60 extreme
Notes / locked rules: Too high can create awkward short-shot spam and lower paint FG%.

Definition: Frequency of point-blank/rim finishes (layups, dunks, drop-offs).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 emergency; 20 rare; 30 occasional; 40 normal; 50 rim-focused; 60 extreme
Notes / locked rules: Primary driver of points in the paint; rim scorers typically Under > Close.

Definition: Overall willingness to take mid-range jumpers (any context).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 emergency; 20 very rare; 30 occasional; 40 normal; 50 featured weapon
Notes / locked rules: Master gate for mid-range behavior.

Definition: Catch-and-shoot mid-range willingness (no dribble).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 avoids; 20 reluctant; 30 willing; 40 comfortable
Notes / locked rules: Rule: Spot-Up Mid = Shot Mid.

Definition: Willingness to shoot mid-range immediately after coming off a screen.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 curl/pass; 20 read first; 30 shoot if clean; 40 fires confidently
Notes / locked rules: Rule: Off-Screen Mid = Shot Mid.

Definition: Overall willingness to take 3PT jumpers.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 emergency; 20 very low; 30 low; 40 normal; 50 high; 60 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Keep caps modest to avoid 3PT spam; accuracy handled elsewhere.

Definition: Catch-and-shoot 3PT willingness when feet are set.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 avoids; 20 reluctant; 30 willing; 40 confident; 50 fires; 60 quick-trigger
Notes / locked rules: Should generally be = Shot Three for true spot-up specialists.

Definition: Willingness to shoot immediately after coming off a screen into a 3.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 curl & pass; 20 read first; 30 shoot if clean; 40 fires; 55 elite mover
Notes / locked rules: Controls screen-read speed; too high creates instant-fire spam.

Definition: Willingness to take mid-range jumpers with a defender close/contesting.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 avoid; 20 rare bailout; 30 occasional; 40 tough-shot taker; 45 elite tough-shot
Notes / locked rules: Gameplay-impactful; keep low for most players.

Definition: Willingness to take contested 3PT jumpers.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 avoid; 20 rare bailout; 30 occasional; 35 tough-shot specialist; 40 elite
Notes / locked rules: Too high breaks shot quality and sim efficiency.

Definition: Use of step-back move into a mid-range jumper.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 40 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: Step-Back Mid cap = 40.

Definition: Use of step-back move into a 3PT jumper.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 35 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: Step-Back 3 cap = 35 (and generally = Step-Back Mid).

Definition: Use of spin move into a jumper (usually mid-range).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Keep low outside of true spin-jumper users.

Definition: Pull-up 3PT taken in transition (early offense).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 willing; 40 confident; 45 specialist
Notes / locked rules: High values create fast-break chucking.

Definition: Pull-up mid-range jumper off dribble in halfcourt.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 40 featured; 50 elite
Notes / locked rules: Primary creators can be higher; avoid for non-creators.

Definition: Pull-up 3PT off dribble in halfcourt.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 40 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low to prevent spam and sim efficiency distortion.

Definition: Overall willingness to attack off the dribble to the rim (downhill).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 low; 30 occasional; 40 normal; 50 frequent; 60 elite driver cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED preference: Drive = downhill attacking (not setup dribbles).

Definition: Willingness to attack a closeout off a catch (one or two dribbles).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 low; 30 occasional; 40 normal; 50 frequent; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Higher values help read closeouts instead of instant shots.

Definition: Willingness to curl/attack after receiving ball off an off-ball screen.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 read first; 30 occasional; 40 frequent; 50 cap
Notes / locked rules: Balances against Off-Screen 3 for smarter reads.

Definition: Preference to finish layups off the backboard when applicable.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 40 frequent; 55 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Higher for angle/english finishers.

Definition: Use of step-through footwork to finish around defenders.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Mostly bigs and crafty finishers.

Definition: Use of spin layup gather/finish.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 55 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Keep low unless real-life spin finisher.

Definition: Use of eurostep to avoid contact at rim.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 55 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Guards/wings who actually euro frequently.

Definition: Use of hop step gather at rim.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 55 specialist
Notes / locked rules: High values can create hop-step spam.

Definition: Use of floater/push shot in lane (runner).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 55 specialist
Notes / locked rules: Craft guards; keep low for non-floater users.

Definition: Willingness to dunk off two feet/standing near rim (often from dump-offs).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 40 frequent; 60 power finisher
Notes / locked rules: Relates to role, athleticism, and hands.

Definition: Willingness to dunk while driving to the rim.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 40 frequent; 60 elite
Notes / locked rules: Keep aligned with Driving Layup tendencies elsewhere.

Definition: Use of flashy dunk animations when dunking.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 showtime; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: Flashy Dunk cap = 55.

Definition: Ability/willingness to finish alley-oops with dunks (when available).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 frequent; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: Alley-Oop Finish cap = 55.

Definition: Willingness to attempt putback finishes after offensive rebounds.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 frequent; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: Putback cap = 55.

Definition: Crash = tendency to fall to the floor after heavy contact/collisions (most noticeable on drives/finishes and some rebound traffic). Higher = more fall-down/collision reactions; lower = stays on feet more.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0–10: Almost never goes down. 15–25: Rare falls. 30–40: Occasional falls in heavy traffic. 45–55: Frequent falls on contact (can look chaotic). 60+: Constant wipeouts (spam/ugly).
Typical NBA range: NBA-style gameplay norm: ~15–35 most players; physical bigs/wings up to ~40.
Notes / locked rules: NOT offensive rebounding effort. If you see players flying/falling everywhere when high, that’s Crash doing its thing. Keep low-to-mid for realism; only bump for players who genuinely hit the deck a lot.

Definition: Bias to drive to the player’s right side (handedness/comfort).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never right; 25 prefers left; 50 balanced; 75 prefers right; 100 always right
Notes / locked rules: Adjust for handedness; lefties often lower than right-handed peers.

Definition: Use of pump fakes from triple-threat stance.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 frequent; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Higher for crafty wings/shot fakers.

Definition: Use of jab steps from triple-threat stance.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 frequent; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Higher for face-up scorers.

Definition: How long player holds/pauses in triple-threat before acting (probe vs instant).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 instant decision; 10 very quick; 20 quick; 30 normal; 40 slow cap
Notes / locked rules: Too high can stall offense; too low can cause instant shots.

Definition: Willingness to shoot directly out of triple-threat without dribbling.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 willing; 40 confident; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Balance with TT Idle for better reads.

Definition: Use of size-up dribbles to set up an attack.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 low; 30 normal; 40 frequent; 55 creator cap
Notes / locked rules: Primary creators higher; bigs low.

Definition: Use of hesitation setup dribble to trigger attack.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 low; 30 normal; 40 frequent; 55 creator cap
Notes / locked rules: Often similar to Size Up; keep realistic.

Definition: Amount of idle/probing dribbles before an attack begins (NOT creativity). Higher = more probing.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 5–10 zero-dribble; 15 non-creators; 20 low-usage guards; 25 hub bigs; 30 primary creators; 35 methodical creators cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED SCALE + ABSOLUTE CAP 35.

Definition: Use of crossover move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of double crossover move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of spin move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of half spin move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of step back move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of behind the back move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of dribble hesitation move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Use of in and out move while driving.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 part of game; 45 creator; 55 specialist cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for non-creators; half-spin typically for creators.

Definition: Reluctance to use ANY dribble moves while driving. Higher = more straight-line drives.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 always uses moves; 20 uses moves often; 40 mixed; 60 mostly straight; 80 almost never
Notes / locked rules: Rim runners/bigs higher; creative guards lower.

Definition: Permission/animation bias to finish through contact vs finesse at rim (NOT foul frequency).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 finesse only; 20 light contact; 30 normal; 45 strong; 55 power finisher; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: Safe bands 20–30 most, 35–45 strong wings, 45–55 power bigs, cap 60.

Definition: Likelihood to pass to an open teammate when driving/penetrating (kick-outs).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 40 willing; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Gameplay: too high causes mid-air kickouts; keep most =45 unless elite passer.

Definition: Likelihood to attempt flashy passes (riskier).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 showy; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep modest to avoid turnover spam.

Definition: Likelihood to throw alley-oop passes.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 frequent; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Higher for elite lob passers; still keep controlled.

Definition: Balance slider for screener: 0 = pure pop, 100 = pure roll.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 pop only; 25 mostly pop; 50 balanced; 75 mostly roll; 100 roll only
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: combined tendency (not separate). Avoid 0/100 unless extreme role.

Tendency: Transition Spot Up vs Cut to Basket
Definition: Balance in transition: 0 = always cut, 100 = always spot up.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 cut only; 25 mostly cut; 50 balanced; 75 mostly spot; 100 spot only
Notes / locked rules: LOCKED: combined tendency (not separate).

Definition: How often player chooses isolation when guarded by that defender tier.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 5 almost never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 35 willing; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Most non-creators should be 0–10, especially vs Elite.

Definition: How often player chooses isolation when guarded by that defender tier.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 5 almost never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 35 willing; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Most non-creators should be 0–10, especially vs Elite.

Definition: How often player chooses isolation when guarded by that defender tier.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 5 almost never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 35 willing; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Most non-creators should be 0–10, especially vs Elite.

Definition: How often player chooses isolation when guarded by that defender tier.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 5 almost never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 35 willing; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Most non-creators should be 0–10, especially vs Elite.

Definition: Likelihood to follow plays/assignments vs freelancing (affects structure).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 chaos; 20 very loose; 35 loose; 50 normal; 65 disciplined; 75 cap
Notes / locked rules: Too low can cause random actions; too high can reduce improvisation.

Definition: Willingness to attempt drawing charges.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 willing; 45 specialist; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Gameplay: too high can create unrealistic charge hunting.

Definition: General foul tendency (frequency of committing fouls). Lower is safer.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 very disciplined; 20 disciplined; 35 normal; 45 physical; 60 reckless cap
Notes / locked rules: Use with Hard Foul to control aggression without whistle spam.

Definition: Likelihood of hard fouls (strong contact / wrap-ups).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 frequent; 55 cap
Notes / locked rules: Keep low for realism; mostly for enforcers/bigs.

Definition: Aggressiveness jumping lanes / intercepting passes (off-ball).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 aggressive; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Too high can create teleport steals if gameplay sliders also high.

Definition: Aggressiveness reaching for steals on-ball.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 aggressive; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Balance with foul rates; high reach increases fouls/whiffs.

Definition: Aggressiveness attempting blocks at the rim.
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 aggressive; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Too high can create jumpy help and leave glass exposed.

Definition: Aggressiveness contesting shots (closeouts, hands up, challenges).
Scale bands (0–100 meaning): 0 never; 10 rare; 20 occasional; 30 normal; 45 strong; 60 cap
Notes / locked rules: Pairs with gameplay Help Defense + Contest sliders; avoid stacking extremes.
